intro: Chamissoa maximiliani var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent chamissoa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy or pubescent foliage, which gives it its varietal name. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is noted for its hardiness and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
